text: malaysians openly defied a police band
to make their voices heard at times it
felt more like a party but this rally
had a stern message for the prime
minister Malaysians want transparency
these protesters are directing their
anger at one man Prime Minister Najib
Razak he's been facing allegations of
mismanaging a state fund called 1mdb and
also for allegedly taking public money
now he has denied any wrongdoing saying
the money came from a donation and the
anti-corruption agency has also cleared
him of any wrongdoing still for many
Malaysians here
they say this explanation is simply not
good enough some excuses that they gave
us is like so stupid stupid and so ahead
of put donation billion billion u.s.
dollar in your bank account and then you
say that is donation our Prime Minister
have a lot of accusation to answer the
one Malaysia dB the 2.6 billion where's
the answer police declared this 34 hour
rally illegal but they didn't move
against the crowd likely because they
had support from within Prime Minister
Najib Sparty such as this man his mentor
turned fiercest critic Mahathir Mohamad
there is no more rule of law the only
way for the people to get back to the
old system is for them to remove this
prime minister we must remove this prime
minister mr. mahir is an unlikely ally
he's been blamed for creating a system
that allowed this current scandal to
happen organizers say the country's
leadership has grown complacent because
the Barisan Nasional coalition has been
in power for almost six decades it's an
accumulation of frustration that for 58
years we've been asking for
accountability and still we don't get it
so far mr. Najib has responded to his
critics by sack
his deputy for questioning him over the
scandal and removing the Attorney
General investigating him he may have
bought himself more time but these
protesters want to send a message to the
world that something has gone terribly
wrong it seems a long way from the
catwalk but in recent years the bulk of
Australia's saltwater crocodile farms
have been bought up by the fashion
industry okay so there was no fraud in
their 2010 South African woke up
